pullRequest.title: Response server- GET /participant/get-activity-state and POST  /participant/update-activity-state API integration test cases
pullRequest.bodyText: Response server- GET /participant/get-activity-state and POST  /participant/update-activity-state API integration test cases

commit.message: Partcicpant activity state integration test cases

nodes.bodyText:
[response-server Checks] reported by reviewdog 🐶
Missing a Javadoc comment.

[response-server Checks] reported by reviewdog 🐶
Distance between variable 'headers' declaration and its first usage is 4, but allowed 3.  Consider making that variable final if you still need to store its value in advance (before method calls that might have side effects on the original value).

[response-server Checks] reported by reviewdog 🐶
Distance between variable 'headers' declaration and its first usage is 4, but allowed 3.  Consider making that variable final if you still need to store its value in advance (before method calls that might have side effects on the original value).

Please construct an ActivityStateBean within this file using set variables and refrain from using external JSON files when possible. Then for building the requestParams in line 99-100 you can just say requestParams.add("studyId", TEST_ACTIVITY_STATE_BEAN.getStudyId()), and it will be clear what test case you are trying to construct without having to refer to the json file.
Check for values of the expected response here too without using external JSON?
Please reorder the Tests in this class - all get-activity-state tests then all the update-activity-state tests.
You can just check for empty array and failure message here. No need for the short external json file
